title: What are the different uses of Google maps? - Quora

response.answer_text: Google maps is one of the best map applications used in the world. some uses of Google maps are: Locate any place on the map with the information of latitude and longitude.(This feature is available in various other applications too).personalised details of places you visit:you can know how much distance you have travelledyou can have your own timeline to track the places you visit.Google maps gives dynamic updates about the traffic and gives suggestions of alternate routes for avoiding the traffic.Google database also has the details of the local transport service, one the use them to know the details of the public transport available.Satellite view: satellite view enables the user to look at the earth of particular area (these are photographs taken by satellites which are updated repeatedly ) .one can also become “Local Guides ” for google maps which enables the user to add place on the google maps , and also to suggest an edit to the existing database.one can also download a part of map for offline use.

One of the widely accepted use case of Google Maps is for food delivery business. In the fiercely competitive market of food delivery, the delivery time makes up for a huge differentiator. Here’s the story about how MediaAgility leveraged location intelligence powered by Google Maps to optimize restaurant delivery orders for a leading pizza chain. Here’s How With Location Intelligence, a Leading Pizza Chain Increased Orders Delivery by 75 - 100% | MediaAgility Also, here’s how Google Maps in various businesses can power up BI efforts: Doorstep services - With location powered Doorstep services, businesses are empowering customers with self service channels to avail pick-up and delivery services right at the convenience of their home or office. Field Force Automation - Power of tracking and managing in real-time the location, timing, and speed of the operations can actually boost up your workforce productivity and spell out success by delivering improved customer experience Location Data - empowers decision makers to make more informed decisions and gain a competitive ‘edge’ by visualizing key metrics on maps such as population density in an area, gender ratio, number of high income household, and competition penetration in an area. …and much more.
